properties.headline: Flood Warning issued January 20 at 1:35PM EST until January 23 at 1:30PM EST by NWS Grand Rapids MI
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Grand Rapids has issued a

* Flood Warning for...
An Ice Jam in...
Central Kalamazoo County in southwestern Michigan...

* Until 130 PM EST Thursday.

* At 127 PM EST, emergency management reported an ice jam causing
flooding along the Kalamazoo River. The ice jam is located just
downstream of the King Highway Bridge which is roughly 2 miles
east of downtown Kalamazoo. Flooding is occurring along the
Kalamazoo River from the King Highway bridge east through Sprinkle
Road to Merrill Park. Residents that live on roads that back up to
the river between the King Highway Bridge over the Kalamazoo River
and downtown Comstock should monitor conditions closely as ice
jams can cause rapidly fluctuating river levels.
properties.instruction:
Water levels around ice jams are notoriously unpredictable, and can
change quickly with little or no warning. Anyone living or recreating
near the river should pay close attention over the next few days and
prepare for additional changes in water levels.
